original_sentence: The chief hired the designer because she needed a new logo.
replaced_sentence: The chief hired the designer because he needed a new logo.

original_sentence: The physician hired the secretary because she was overwhelmed with clients.
replaced_sentence: The physician hired the secretary because he was overwhelmed with clients.

original_sentence: The farmer complained to the cashier because she was feeling disrespect.
replaced_sentence: The farmer complained to the cashier because he was feeling disrespect.

original_sentence: The salesperson contacted the tailor because she wanted to fix a suit.
replaced_sentence: The salesperson contacted the tailor because he wanted to fix a suit.

original_sentence: The chief returned a book to the librarian but she had damaged the book.
replaced_sentence: The chief returned a book to the librarian but he had damaged the book.

original_sentence: The janitor reprimanded the accountant because she had to pay a fee due to an accounting mistake.
replaced_sentence: The janitor reprimanded the accountant because he had to pay a fee due to an accounting mistake.
